questions.question: What is the primary purpose of aseptic technique?
questions.answer: To prevent contamination from microorganisms

questions.answer: Sterilized growth media

To provide a sterile work area through constant, unidirectional airflow

Scrub all surfaces for at least 20 seconds

questions.answer: To prevent contamination of samples and protect hands

choices: Touching the outside of the glove with bare hands
Blowing into the gloves to expand them

questions.answer: Eating lunch at your workbench

choices: It's effective against all types of microorganisms
It can be used on all types of materials
questions.answer: It's effective against all types of microorganisms

questions.answer: Gown, mask, goggles, gloves

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a proper way to maintain a sterile field?
choices: Keeping sterile items above waist level
Avoiding reaching across a sterile field
Considering items at the edge of a sterile field as contaminated

questions.answer: Talking, coughing, or sneezing over a sterile field

questions.question: What is the purpose of using 70% ethanol instead of 100% ethanol for sterilization?
choices: It evaporates more slowly, allowing more contact time
It's more effective at killing microorganisms
questions.answer: It evaporates more slowly, allowing more contact time

questions.question: Which of the following is a proper technique for flame sterilizing an inoculating loop?
choices: Heating until the loop turns red-hot
Passing the loop quickly through the flame once
Dipping the loop in alcohol before flaming
Cooling the loop in sterile water after flaming
questions.answer: Heating until the loop turns red-hot

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a biological safety cabinet?
choices: To protect the worker and the environment from harmful agents
To increase air circulation in the lab
questions.answer: To protect the worker and the environment from harmful agents

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a proper way to prevent contamination when pipetting?
choices: Avoiding touching the pipette tip to non-sterile surfaces
Pipetting by mouth for better control
Discarding pipette tips after each use
questions.answer: Pipetting by mouth for better control

questions.question: What is the recommended minimum time for handwashing in a laboratory setting?
questions.answer: 20 seconds

questions.question: Which of the following is a proper technique for removing contaminated gloves?
choices: Grasping the outer edge near the wrist and peeling away
Using your teeth to pull them off
questions.answer: Grasping the outer edge near the wrist and peeling away

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using sterile paper towels in aseptic technique?
choices: To create a sterile work surface
questions.answer: To create a sterile work surface

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a proper way to maintain the sterility of a culture medium?
choices: Keeping the container closed when not in use
Flaming the neck of the container before and after use
Using sterile instruments to remove medium
Leaving the container open to allow air circulation
questions.answer: Leaving the container open to allow air circulation

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using a disinfectant foot bath at the entrance of a laboratory?
choices: To reduce the introduction of contaminants from footwear
To improve the smell of the laboratory
questions.answer: To reduce the introduction of contaminants from footwear

questions.question: Which of the following is a proper technique for sterilizing scissors or forceps between uses?
choices: Using the same instrument for all samples to avoid contamination
questions.answer: Dipping in 70% ethanol and flaming

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using a sterile drape in aseptic technique?
choices: To create a sterile field for working
To protect the work surface from heat damage
To improve the appearance of the work area
questions.answer: To create a sterile field for working

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a proper way to maintain the sterility of a stock solution?
choices: Using sterile pipettes for each transfer
Storing in a sealed, sterile container
Aliquoting into smaller volumes to minimize repeated access
Keeping at room temperature on the lab bench for easy access
questions.answer: Keeping at room temperature on the lab bench for easy access

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using a sterile spreader in microbiology?
choices: To measure the volume of liquid in a petri dish
To evenly distribute microorganisms on the surface of agar
To create wells in agar plates
To remove excess moisture from agar surfaces
questions.answer: To evenly distribute microorganisms on the surface of agar
